question.body: Why is it more difficult for our body to repair cartilage then bone?

multiple_choice.choice: Bone formation is less regulated by hormones.
Cartilage formation is regulated by more hormones.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Bone has a blood supply so it is vascular and it is easy to get nutrients to it.
Correct. Cartilage is avascular and the nutrient supply is more limited.
Incorrect. There are more hormones controlling bone formation then cartilage formation.
Incorrect. There are more hormones controlling bone formation then cartilage formation.
